page.title: 05Mr Smith Of Buckden Station
page.content: {Mr Smith}was born in 01-03-1904 at Luton.He came from Southend to Buckden in 1926 as a porter.In 1938 he was made station master.{Brampton}station was opened in 1866.Its' name was changed to{Buckden}in 1887 because there were too many Bramptons.The station was on the Cambridge to Kettering line.It was kept busy with the hay,corn and coal trades.Its' busiest time was during the last war.Trains to the American hospital at Diddington,bomb trains to Kimbolton airfield and troop trains were then frequent users of the line.On 15th of June 1959 the station was closed. Mr Smith continues to live at the old station house.Now the platform is a gravel terrace,the signal box is a greenhouse & the tracks are part of the garden.
